db:abstract.db:para: The QCameraFocusZone class provides information on zones used for autofocusing a camera.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: For cameras that support autofocusing, in order for a camera to autofocus on part of a sensor frame, it considers different zones within the frame. Which zones to use, and where the zones are located vary between different cameras.
This class exposes what zones are used by a particular camera, and a list of the zones can be retrieved by a QCameraFocus instance.
You can use this information to present visual feedback - for example, drawing rectangles around areas of the camera frame that are in focus, or changing the color of a zone as it comes into focus.

db:section.db:title: QCameraFocusZone::QCameraFocusZone(const QCameraFocusZone &other)
db:section.db:para: Creates a new QCameraFocusZone as a copy of other.

db:section.db:title: QRectF QCameraFocusZone::area() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the area of the camera frame that this focus zone encompasses.
Coordinates are in frame relative coordinates - QPointF(0,0) is the top left of the frame, and QPointF(1,1) is the bottom right.

db:section.db:title: bool QCameraFocusZone::isValid() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if this focus zone has a valid area and status.

db:section.db:title: QCameraFocusZone::FocusZoneStatus QCameraFocusZone::status() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the current status of this focus zone.

db:section.db:title: bool QCameraFocusZone::operator!=(const QCameraFocusZone &other) const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if this focus zone is not the same as other.

db:section.db:title: bool QCameraFocusZone::operator==(const QCameraFocusZone &other) const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if this focus zone is the same as other.
